metadata.title: CASE 281/04: Investigation of Contractual Irregularities at Pristina Airport
metadata.primary_source: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo

overview: The investigation report details irregularities concerning the addition of a single-source contract at Pristina International Airport post the award of a larger contract, highlighting potential corruption and procurement breaches.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Resolution mandating UNMIK to administer Kosovo, including state-owned assets.
Regulation establishing UNMIK's administrative duties in Kosovo.

methodology.description: The investigation was conducted under UNMIK Executive Decision No 2003/16, through witness interviews and document reviews.
documents_reviewed: Audit report of Pristina International Airport, 2003-02-28
Procurement records from Pristina Airport administration

background.context: The case centers around added contracts and procurement irregularities at a state-controlled airport under UNMIK administration.
timeline: 2001;2003: Maintenance by PEAP in cooperation with KFOR under Yugoslavian law
2004-04-01: Pristina Airport handed over to civilian jurisdiction under ICAO regulations

allegations.description: Addition of a single-source contract for one container following a larger contract.
allegations.findings: Absence of proper records and financial approval documents for the main contract.

allegations.description: Competitive tender for the supply of new containers and services held.
allegations.findings: Main contract awarded to the lowest bidder, but subsequent single-source contract lacked justification documents.

findings: Competitive tender for the main contract appears justified.
Single-source contract addition justified based on KFOR documentation.

actions: Refer matter to the D/SRSG of Pillar IV for appropriate action regarding contract file management.
